column4: ow can you run a program as a different user if kde is loged in as a non-admin account? (non-admin meaning an account with no sudo access) The "run as different user" option in Run Command only seems to want a sudo password, instead of the password for the user whom you're trying to run the program as.
when ever I use su it complains that it can't connct to xserver.
ahh yes, $DISPLAY and x server access... hmm i dunno :/
